column4: woah... it wants to remove ubuntu-desktop?
does that package work both ways? ie will it pull off everything it brought with it?
I suppose the metapackage won't be there to upgrade everything that's needed
( if you call them metapackages over here )
I suppose I could reinstall it as part of my upgrade plan
better than this nonsense - I'm not keeping pulseaudio, I'm afraid :)
right, I have a plan. Thanks
I'd rather just have my old sound system, which was perfectly functional for me in every way
i think you can easily configure all the apps to use ALSA and disable pulseaudio in the session
All the gamers I know who use ubuntu have had lots of problems with pulseaudio, with games, with teamspeak, with in-game voice chat - I wonder if the wiki should point out
what, and it actually takes effort to set that up with the gnome apps?
you are referring to what? using ALSA?
